conclusion: Analyze forces to find dynamic friction coefficient between hemisphere A and the left wall.
Hemispheres A and B are between vertical walls with a 30Â° angle between the line connecting their centers and the horizontal.
Identify forces on hemisphere A: weight \( W_A = m \cdot g \), normal force \( N_A \), frictional force \( f_A \).
Identify forces on hemisphere B: weight \( W_B = 2m \cdot g \), normal force \( N_B \), frictional force \( f_B \).
Frictional forces balance components of normal forces to prevent sliding.
Horizontal component of \( N_A \) balances \( f_A \): \( N_{Ax} = N_A \cos(30^\circ) \).
Vertical component of \( N_A \) balances weight: \( N_{Ay} = W_A \).
Maximum static friction equals sliding friction: \( f_s = f_k \).
